labels.analysis: The MCP Server primarily focuses on providing real-time weather data, specifically temperature information, for any geographic location. The sole available tool, "get_live_temp", retrieves live temperature data based on latitude and longitude coordinates. This functionality suggests that the server is specialized in delivering accurate and up-to-date weather forecasts, making it useful for applications requiring weather information integration without needing to manage weather APIs directly.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Weather" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around weather data, particularly temperature forecast. The secondary label "API Integration" is added because the server appears to provide a ready-to-use API for accessing weather data. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.name: Weather Forecast
server_info_crawled.author: @eminaltan6809/weather-forecast-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide current temperature data for any geographic location using real-time weather information. Enable applications to access accurate and up-to-date weather forecasts seamlessly. Simplify integration of weather data into your workflows with a ready-to-use API server.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@eminaltan6809/weather-forecast-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
